There are several ways to get around Hokkaido and explore its food spots:

1. Rent a car: Hokkaido has an excellent road network with easy-to-follow directions, making it easy to rent a car and explore the area on your own schedule. 2. Train: JR Hokkaido operates trains that connect the major cities of Hokkaido to each other. The trains run regularly and provide a comfortable and convenient way to travel around Hokkaido. 3. Bus: If you prefer public transportation, then Hokkaido has a extensive bus network that connects all the major tourist spots and cities. 4. Bicycle: Hokkaido is known for its scenic biking routes, and cycling is an excellent way to explore the region's rural areas and small towns. 5. Tours: Many companies offer guided tours of Hokkaido that include food tastings, sightseeing, and transportation in a single package. In conclusion, there are various ways to get around Hokkaido and experience all the great food spots the region has to offer. Choosing the right mode of transportation will depend on your preferences and budget, so you can select the option that suits you best.
